channel.title: A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content on A Hugo website

item.title: About Me
item.description: Experienced economist with a double major in Business Management and PhD student in the University of Illinois. I have advance knowledge in finance, quantitative analysis, machine learning, statistical learning, economic and econometric analysis. I have more than 5 years of experience in data analysis in multiple sectors using statistical and object aimed programming software like R, Python, and STATA. My research focuses in the intersection of development, finance and price analysis using machine learning Technics.

item.title: Plot nice histograms with ggplot
item.description: Data set For this example we are going to use the LendingClub data. This data set has information of thousands of loans made. In order to get the data we must run the follow code: library(openintro) ## Loading required package: airports ## Loading required package: cherryblossom ## Loading required package: usdata library(tidyverse) ## -- Attaching packages --------------------------------------- tidyverse 1.3.1 -- ## v ggplot2 3.3.5 v purrr 0.3.4 ## v tibble 3.

item.title: Simple plot for regression analysis
item.description: In this post we are going to explore the ways to do regression analysis and how to plot them. We are going to use the famous dataset cars that has R. For the analysis we need to use a library called lm. We are going to check if the distance can predict the distance with the following model: \[dist = \beta_0 + \beta_1speed+\epsilon\] This model can be done with the following command
